name: Robert Goldstrom
biography:
Artist and Illustrator.
B.A.,  University of Michigan, 1974. Created theatre sets and posters.
1979, moved to New York; began painting in oil.
Exhibitions: New York Society of Illustrators, 1980-1992; United Nations, "The Artist and the Enviroment, 1990; Lustrare Gallery, New York, 1991.
Featured in Communication Arts, American Illustration and Publishers Weekly.
Awards: Gold and  Silver Medals, New York Society of Illustrators. Silver Medal, Society of Publication Designers.
Clients include: The New York Times, Time Magazine, Life Magazine, Esquire, The Atlantic, Sony Music, Bear Stearns.
Publishing companies include: Random House, Doubleday, Henry Holt and Macmillan.
Biography source: Robert Goldstrom, 2001.
